item.title: DESCEND - Gene expression distribution deconvolution in scRNA-seq
item.description: Microarray and bulk RNA-seq data measure. Background knowledge Goal of this paper Methods behind DESCEND Results Model evaluation Case studies Effect of cell size on differential non-zero mean and fraction analysis DESCEND improves accuracy of cell type identification, by selecting better highly variable genes Take-home messages When all across-cell differences are accounted for, Poisson distribution is sufficient to capture technical noise in UMI-based scRNA-seq counts.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: Elements showcase
item.description: Check out how Tranquilpeak theme display well HTML elements (title, paragraph, blockquote, table and more..). It’s simple and elegant.

item.title: Cover image showcase
item.description: Tranquilpeak integrate a unique “cover image” feature. Open this post to see how this feature sublimate your article.

item.title: Projects
item.description: A time-based model of altered circadian gene expression for Neurospora crassa. The circadian clock is a major regulator of gene expression in many organisms, and is able to drive important metabolic functions in response to cyclical environmental factors. Neurospora crassa has long served as a model organism to study the circadian clock, given that a high proportion of its genes are under circadian control and that phenotypic changes in response to the clock are easily observed.

item.title: Publications
item.description: The latest list can be found on my Google Scholar profile. PDFs, code and datasets can be found on the Research Projects page. Journal Papers Y. Zhang, W. E. Johnson, Combat-Seq: A Fundamental Contribution to Human Knowledge. in Science Vol. 1, 2018. Conference Papers D. Mrowca, M. Rohrbach, J. Hoffman, R. Hu, K. Saenko, T. Darrell, Spatial Semantic Regularisation for Large Scale Object Detection. in ICCV, 2015.

item.title: Software
item.description: SimulatorZ Zhang Y, Bernau C and Waldron L (2014). simulatorZ: Simulator for Collections of Independent Genomic Data Sets. R package version 1.4.0, http://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/simulatorZ.html

item.title: Yuqing Zhang
item.description: About Me As a doctoral student at Boston University, my interest lies in applying statistical and computational approaches in biological problems. Formerly trained at School of Mathematical Sciences at Peking University in the area of applied math, I am currently in an ambitious persuit of a balance between the abstract beauty of theoretical math and the practical applications which serves for the benefit of a large population.

item.title: highlighted code showcase
item.description: Tranquilpeak Hugo theme have its own theme to highlight source code. It’s based on GitHub theme: simple and elegant. Check out how it sublimate source codes.
